input.title: [Security] Restrict network access for Key Vaults (AZ-003)
input.body:
## Issue Description
Multiple Key Vaults have open network access, which is a high-severity risk.

Affected instances:
- ai-empire-vault-01
- seobaike-vault

## Recommended Fix
- Configure private endpoints or virtual network service endpoints to restrict access.
- Ensure firewall rules allow only trusted IPs if necessary.

Priority: High
Module: Azure

Please assign to infrastructure team for manual review and fix.

input.title: [Security] Disable public network access for AI Services (AZ-004)
input.body:
## Issue Description
Multiple Azure AI services have public network access enabled, which is a medium-severity risk.

Affected instances:
- ai-empire-openai-australiaeast
- ai-empire-openai-eastus
- ai-empire-openai-japaneast
- ai-empire-openai-southeastasia
- ai-empire-openai-swedencentral
- ai-empire-openai-uksouth
- ai-empire-openai-westeurope
- ai-empire-openai-westus

## Recommended Fix
- Set publicNetworkAccess to 'Disabled' for each account.
- Use private endpoints for secure access.

Priority: Medium
Module: Azure

Please assign to infrastructure team for manual review and fix.

input.title: [Security] Change GitHub Repository Visibility to Private (GH-001)
input.body:
## Issue Description
The repository is set to public, exposing source code which is a high-severity risk.

## Recommended Fix
- Change repository visibility to private.
- Review if any sensitive information was exposed and take necessary actions (e.g., rotate keys).

Priority: High
Module: GitHub

Please assign to devops team for immediate action.

input.title: [Maintenance] Investigate and Fix Failed GitHub Actions Workflow (GH-003)
input.body:
## Issue Description
The most recent GitHub Actions workflow execution has failed, which is a medium-severity issue potentially affecting CI/CD pipeline.

## Recommended Fix
- Review the failed workflow run logs.
- Identify and resolve the root cause (e.g., dependency issues, configuration errors).
- Rerun the workflow to confirm fix.

Priority: Medium
Module: GitHub

Please assign to devops team for review.

input.content:
## Azure Security Issues

### Problem: AZ-003 - Key Vault Open Network Access (High)
- Root Cause: Default network settings allow public access, exposing secrets to potential attacks.
- Repair Strategy: High difficulty - Manual configuration of private endpoints or firewall rules required. Automation limited due to tool restrictions (azure_run_cli is read-only and has verb limitations).
- Validation: Use 'az keyvault show' or equivalent (but tool may block subcommands).
- Notes: If automation fails, mark as pending and notify team manually.

### Problem: AZ-004 - AI Service Public Network Access (Medium)
- Root Cause: Public network access enabled by default, allowing unauthorized access.
- Repair Strategy: Medium difficulty - Manually disable via Azure CLI or portal. Tool limitations prevent direct fixes.
- Validation: Query properties.publicNetworkAccess.
- Notes: Multiple instances; group in tracking.

### Tool Limitations
- azure_run_cli only allows specific verbs like 'list', 'show', etc., but subcommands like 'resource list' or 'keyvault show' may be blocked.
- For future: Request expanded read-only access or additional tools for Azure modifications.

## GitHub Security Issues

### Problem: GH-001 - Public Repository (High)
- Root Cause: Repository visibility set to public, risking code exposure.
- Repair Strategy: High difficulty - Manual change to private visibility. No direct tool for automation.
- Notes: If github_create_issue fails (e.g., 403 permissions), mark as pending and escalate manually.

### Problem: GH-003 - Failed Actions Execution (Medium)
- Root Cause: Workflow failures in CI/CD pipeline.
- Repair Strategy: Medium difficulty - Manual investigation of logs and fixes.
- Notes: Track recent runs; automate monitoring if possible in future.

### Tool Limitations
- github_create_issue may fail due to integration permissions (403 error). Ensure proper OAuth scopes for the integration.
